2.name: Axe, battle
2.descrip: A massive battle axe made for cleaving bodies in two.

3.name: Axe, hand
3.descrip: A handy axe for wood and limb chopping, can be thrown.

4.name: Bardiche
4.descrip: This pole arm has a large wicked curved blade at the end perfect for thrust and slash attacks.

5.name: Bec de corbin
5.descrip: This polearm has two nasty spikes and a striking surface good for piercing armor and crushing helms.

6.name: Bill-Guisarme
6.descrip: This pole arm has applications in agriculture as well as combat with it's curved blades for hooking and flat blade for slashing and spearing.

7.name: Bow, composite short
7.descrip: A finely crafted bow made from multiple natural materials.

8.name: Bow, composite long
8.descrip: A finely crafted long bow made from multiple natural materials.

9.name: Bow, Long
9.descrip: A finely crafted long bow made from multiple natural materials.

10.name: Bow, Short
10.descrip: A finely crafted short bow made from multiple natural materials.

11.name: Club
11.descrip: A menacing hunk of wood used for bludgeoning or throwing.

12.name: Crossbow, Heavy
12.descrip: A deadly wood and iron Heavy Crossbow for launching deadly projectiles.

13.name: Crossbow, Light
13.descrip: A menacing wood and iron Light Crossbow for launching deadly projectiles.

14.name: Dagger and Scabbard
14.descrip: A vicious double edged blade with leather scabbard.

15.name: Dart
15.descrip: A large lead weighted hand projectile.

16.name: Fauchard
16.descrip: A pole arm with a curved blade.

17.name: Fauchard Fork
17.descrip: A pole arm with a cured blade and a forked tine for catching other pole arms.

18.name: Flail, footman's
18.descrip: A modified farm flail with a metal link atchated to an iron cylinder.

19.name: Flail, Horseman's
19.descrip: A one handed wooedn Shaft with a spiked steel ball attached to a chain.

20.name: Fork, Military
20.descrip: A pole arm with dual symmetric blades with a gap to catch weapons and hooks to snare enemy weapons.

21.name: Glaive
21.descrip: A pole arm with a large curved blade at the end for slashing.

22.name: Glaive-Guisarme
22.descrip: A pole arm with a large curved blade with hooked blades oposite the primary blade. For slashing and hooking.

23.name: Guisarme
23.descrip: A hooked farming blade with a long spike atached to a long pole

24.name: Guisarme-Voulge
24.descrip: A pole arm with a large curved Axe blade with hooked barb oposite the axe head. For hacking and hooking.

25.name: Halberd
25.descrip: A pole arm with a large curved blade with hooked blades oposite the primary blade. For slashing and hooking.

26.name: Hammer, Lucerne
26.descrip: A two handed hammer like weapon, with  3 edges on the head and a spike on the bottom of the handle.

27.name: Hammer
27.descrip: A standard tool for building, bludgeoning and throwing at exposed body parts.

28.name: Javalin
28.descrip: A hand hurdled projectile about the size of a short spear.

29.name: Jo Stick
29.descrip: A hard wood pole which can be hidden in plain sight as a personal walking aid.

30.name: Lance (Medium Horse)
30.descrip: A long conical pole arm will deliver twice rated damage when used from horseback.

31.name: Lance (Light Horse)
31.descrip: A long conical pole arm will deliver twice rated damage when used from horseback.

32.name: Lance (Heavy Horse)
32.descrip: A long conical pole arm will deliver twice rated damage when used from horseback.

33.name: Mace, footman's
33.descrip: A wooden rod with a large iron head for bludgeoning opponents.

34.name: Mace, horseman's
34.descrip: A small iron capped shaft for bludgeoning ground opponents while on horseback.

35.name: Morning Star
35.descrip: A hand held bludgeon with a spiked iron ball on one end.

36.name: Partisan
36.descrip: A long spear like pole arm typacally used to fend off calvary charges. Has curved symmetric segments for catching swords.

37.name: Pick, Military, footman's
37.descrip: A versitile rugged tool and weapon useful for excavation and combat.

38.name: Pick, Military, horseman's
38.descrip: A shortened pick axe used for puncturing or crushing helms and armor from horseback.

39.name: Pike, awl
39.descrip: A long pointed pole arm with a small circular guard.

42.name: Ranseur
42.descrip: A pole arm with a central long point and a crescent blade catch for sword parrying.

45.name: Sling Bullet
45.descrip: Small iron ball for a sling.

47.name: Spear
47.descrip: A weapon which can be used in combat or thrown, double damage recieving charging opponents momentum.

48.name: Spetum
48.descrip: A pole arm with a long central blade and a crescent lower blade for catching weapons and shields.

50.name: Sword, bastard, & scabbard
50.descrip: A large blade with a hand and a half hilt.

51.name: Sword, broad, & scabbard
51.descrip: A double sided blade with a rounded point.

52.name: Sword, long, & scabbard
52.descrip: A double sided blade designed for two handed wielding.

53.name: Sword, short, & scabbard
53.descrip: A double sided blade for single handed wielding.

54.name: Sword, Two Handed
54.descrip: A massive double sided blade for heavy combat.

55.name: Trident
55.descrip: A pole arm with 3 spear points.

56.name: Volgue
56.descrip: A pole arm with a large single edged blade attached to it.
